Article.Abstract: Monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) reactive with Marburg virus (strain Musoke) were evaluated for both biological activity and specificity. Several of the Marburg virus- (MBGV) specific MAbs reduced the size and/or number of MBGV plaques in vitro. The ability of the MAbs to affect plaque formation in vitro was demonstrated to be specific for the glycoprotein (GP) of the strain of MBGV used for vaccination. Using deletion analysis and peptide mapping, the binding epitopes of several of these neutralizing MAbs were identified. Not unexpectedly, the epitopes were shown to lie in the most hypervariable and highly glycosylated region of MBGV GP. An analysis of the in vivo activity of several MAbs revealed that some antibodies provided substantial but incomplete protection of naive guinea pigs by passive transfer. These data suggest that neutralizing epitopes exist within MBGV GP but that induction of antibodies to these neutralizing epitopes may not be sufficient for protection from lethal infection.
Article.ArticleTitle: Characterization of monoclonal antibodies to Marburg virus (strain Musoke) glycoprotein and identification of two protective epitopes.
Article.Affiliations: Virology Division, United States Army Medical Research Institute of Infectious Diseases, Fort Detrick, Frederick, MD 2170, USA. michael.hevey@amedd.army.mil.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The details of the immunization procedure were not described.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: MBGV GP fragment 261-273 inhibited the epitope specific mAb binding to MBGV by ELISA.

AdoptiveTransfer.AdoptiveTransferComments: Cavia porcellus Strain 13 were adoptively transferred with Ascitic Fluid.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific mAb protected guinea pigs from infection with Marburg virus (Musoke strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific mAb bound to killed whole MBGV by ELISA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope was deduced by using two 13-residues (9 residues overlapping) from MBGV GP 257-273 fragment reactive to mAb 7G8 by Western blot.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific mAb neutralized MBGV in an in vitro assay as measured by the number and /or size of plaques of Vero E6 cells when exogenous guinea pig complement was included.
